description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, money and influence reporter Ted Mann looks at the closing phase of President Joe Biden’s term. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden Still Has Work to Do Even as His Power Slowly Ebbs

description: Delegates to the Democratic National Convention will meet virtually within the next two weeks to confirm Vice President Kamala Harris as their nominee for president — and her yet-to-be-named running mate.
title: Democrats Will Nominate Kamala Harris, Running Mate by Aug. 7

description: A federal appeals court said a funding mechanism the US government has relied on for decades to subsidize telecom services for poor and rural users is unconstitutional.
title: Phone Fee to Subsidize Services for US Poor Blocked by Court

description: Former President Donald Trump’s selection of JD Vance as his running mate may signal that a second term could be far less business friendly than corporate dealmakers had hoped.
title: Trump’s Vance Pick Is a Warning That M&A Won’t Get an Easy Pass

description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu offered an unapologetic defense of Israel’s war against Hamas in a fiery speech to Congress, inserting himself into a super-charged moment of American politics and brooking no criticism about the mounting death toll in the Gaza Strip.
title: Netanyahu Tells Congress US and Israel Must ‘Stand Together’

description: All three of the top US bank regulators need to get on the same page when they propose major revisions to the Biden administration’s signature overhaul of capital requirements — or risk causing confusion, a top FDIC official said Wednesday.
title: FDIC Vice Chair Says Bank Capital Plan Needs More Unified Effort

description: Kamala Harris implored Black women “to organize and to mobilize” for her presidential campaign, underscoring the newfound prominence of race in a contest against a Republican nominee she said wants to roll back civil rights.
title: Kamala Harris Rallies Black Support as Race Takes Campaign Foreground

description: Elon Musk has said he will attend Benjamin Netanyahu’s address in the US Capitol on Wednesday as a guest of the Israeli prime minister, said a spokesperson for House Speaker Mike Johnson.
title: Musk to Attend Netanyahu Address as Guest of Israeli Leader

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva pitched a global alliance against hunger and poverty, leveraging Brazil’s presidency of the Group of 20 to make an appeal to officials from the world’s most powerful economies.
title: G-20 Host Brazil Tests Its Global Influence With Alliance Against Hunger and Poverty

description: Donald Trump’s threat to ban Mexican-made cars is a bluff that “isn’t serious,” according to the nation’s President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador.
title: AMLO Accuses Trump of Bluffing With Threat to Ban Mexican Cars

description: Global finance leaders are poised to set limits on Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s call for a global tax on billionaires, consigning the initiative to research on taxation and inequality that could take years to deliver results.
title: Lula’s Billionaire Tax Kicked Into Distant Future as G-20 Sets Limits

description: Former President Donald Trump is scheduled to attend a Hamptons fundraiser next month, providing a cash infusion as his strategy pivots to run against Vice President Kamala Harris.
title: Trump Set to Attend Hamptons Fundraiser Charging Up to $500,000

description: Somaliland warned Somalia against agreeing to a deployment of Turkish troops off the coast of the breakaway state.
title: Somaliland Warns Somalia Against Turkish Navy Deal

description: President Joe Biden’s decision to stand down from his own reelection campaign marks a particularly frustrating conclusion for a man long convinced of his own ability to seal any deal.
title: Biden, Who Built Career on Perseverance, Confronts Its End

description: Republican politicians are setting the US up for a “Liz Truss moment” by promoting policies that would widen fiscal deficits and weaken the dollar, former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said.
title: Summers Says GOP Fiscal Plans Set US Up for ‘Liz Truss Moment’

description: Nigerian lawmakers approved plans to slap banks with a one-time 70% tax on foreign-exchange gains from an initial 50% proposed by President Bola Tinubu to boost the nation’s coffers.
title: Nigerian Banks Asked to Pay 70% Tax on Windfall Foreign-Exchange Gains

description: Democrats moved quickly to project Kamala Harris as a foreign-policy heavyweight, looking to neutralize a Republican attack line and address voter concerns about her ability to tackle the world’s thorniest challenges.
title: Democrats in Overdrive to Burnish Harris Foreign Policy Record

description: Estonia plans to raise defense spending to 4% of gross domestic product, one of the highest levels in NATO, over the next two years to buy ammunition and bolster national security after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
title: Estonia Targets 4% of GDP for Defense Spending to Deter Russia

description: The US probe into the assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump is ongoing and investigators are still assessing the motive of the shooter, according to the head of the FBI.
title: Trump Attacker Flew Drone Before Shooting, FBI Head Says

description: Kamala Harris’s ascent as the likely Democratic presidential nominee is quelling the party’s fears that recent endorsements of Donald Trump by a handful of high-profile venture capitalists might turn Silicon Valley into a Republican stronghold.
title: Silicon Valley Donor Class Is Divided as Harris Support Grows in Tech Stronghold

description: The US is warning homegrown tech startups and venture capital firms that some foreign investments may be fronts for hostile nations seeking data and technology for their governments or to undermine American businesses.
title: US Urges Vigilance by Tech Startups, VC Firms on Foreign Funds

description: UK Chancellor Rachel Reeves could use an imminent review of Labour’s fiscal inheritance to justify tax increases of up to £25 billion ($32.3 billion) in the upcoming budget, according to former Bank of England policymaker Michael Saunders.
title: Ex-BOE Official Predicts Labour Tax Hikes Up to £25 Billion

description: Kamala Harris isn’t wasting any time getting her views on the economy – one of voters’ top concerns in this year’s presidential election – into the spotlight.
title: Kamala Harris Draws on Earlier Career and Campaign for Economy Platform

description: Welcome to the Year of the Elections, Bloomberg’s newsletter on the votes that matter to markets, business and policy amid the most fragmented geo-economic landscape in decades.
title: Venezuela’s Maduro Faces Biggest Threat Yet

description: Poland’s authorities warned of a potential influx of refugees from neighboring Ukraine after Russian forces stepped up attacks on the nation’s energy sector and other critical infrastructure.
title: Poland Warns of Potential Ukrainian Refugee Influx on Kremlin Energy Strikes

description: The UK and Germany will sign their most comprehensive defense declaration ever as part of efforts by Britain’s new prime minister, Keir Starmer, to rebuild post-Brexit ties European allies.
title: UK to Strengthen Defense Ties With Germany in Boost to Industry

description: In Kamala Harris’ first public remarks as the leading Democratic presidential candidate, she vowed to defeat two enemies: Donald Trump and “his extreme Project 2025 agenda.”
title: Harris Targets Trump by Raising Threat of ‘Extreme’ Project 2025

description: The world has made little progress in combating global hunger as conflict, extreme weather and economic challenges restrict people’s access to food, according to the United Nations.
title: The World’s Hunger Problem Is Barely Improving, UN Says

description: India’s government plans to reduce its debt ratio to about 50% of gross domestic product over the coming years and sustain it around that level, a person familiar with the matter said.
title: India’s Government Plans to Steadily Lower Debt Ratio to 50%

description: Wall Street’s Democratic donors have a clear mandate after several rudderless weeks fretting over President Joe Biden’s drag on the party’s chances of winning the White House and Congressional majorities.
title: Wall Street Donors Plan Get-Rich-Quick Ideas for Harris’s Bid

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz vowed to seek a second term in national elections next year despite fading support for his coalition.
title: Germany’s Scholz Sticks to Reelection Plan Despite Struggles

description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi told his Ukrainian counterpart the time was “not yet ripe” for peace talks to end the war with Russia, even as Beijing puts forward its own proposals for an initiative that would include Moscow at the table.
title: China Tells Ukraine Time Not Yet Ripe for Peace Talks to End War

description: The US invited Sudan’s warring sides to cease-fire talks in Switzerland next month, signaling a new push to end the 15-month-old conflict that’s killed tens of thousands of people.
title: US-Backed Talks in Switzerland Are Latest Bid to End Sudan’s War

description: Kenyan President William Ruto named John Mbadi as finance minister, as he completes an overhaul of his administration that’s part of an attempt to end anti-government protests in which at least 54 people have died.
title: Kenyan President Names Opposition’s Mbadi as Treasury Secretary

description: Russia loaded a fourth sanctioned tanker owned by state-run Sovcomflot PJSC, testing the resolve of Group of Seven nations who’re attempting to clamp down on the fleet of ships moving Moscow’s oil.
title: Russia Loads Fourth Sanctioned Sovcomflot Tanker in Snub to West

description: The shock replacement of the Democratic presidential candidate less than four months before the US election has introduced a new element of uncertainty about the outlook for economic policy in 2025 and beyond.
title: ‘Sensationally Unpredictable’ US Election Clouds Policy Outlook

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Netanyahu in the US to Test Harris and Court Trump

description: South Korean prosecutors in July questioned first lady Kim Keon Hee over a designer bag she was suspected of accepting as a gift. The meeting lasted for about 12 hours, according to Yonhap News agency, and put the spotlight back on a case that has dented support for President Yoon Suk Yeol. The handbag encounter in late 2022 was captured on video and touched off a political firestorm when it came to light early this year, with Yoon’s political opponents accusing Kim of corruption. At first, Yoon
title: The Dior Bag Uproar That Shook South Korean Politics

description: Former Home Secretary James Cleverly launched his bid to lead the UK Conservatives, urging his party to consign its divisions to the past in order to overturn Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s “loveless landslide.”
title: Cleverly Launches UK Tory Leadership Bid With Plea for Unity

description: Israeli far-right cabinet member Itamar Ben Gvir took the unusual step of endorsing Donald Trump as the next US president, saying a return of the ex-leader would bolster the chances of victory against Iran’s allied militant groups and the Islamic Republic itself.
title: A Key Netanyahu Coalition Partner Says Trump Is Best for Israel

description: Hungary called on the European Union to broker a solution with Ukraine after Kyiv decided to bar the transit of crude from a major Russian oil supplier.
title: Hungary Calls on EU to Broker Solution on Ukraine Lukoil Transit

description: Prince Albert II faced a call from European anti-bribery inspectors for further transparency surrounding his role as Monaco’s head of state to prevent conflicts of interest.
title: Monaco Prince Faces Call to Stamp Out Conflicts of Interest

description: President Emmanuel Macron called a time out on the worst political crisis to embroil France in recent history, relegating the government to a state of limbo just as the Olympic games are poised to get under way in Paris on Friday.
title: When Will Macron Appoint a New Prime Minister for France? Q&A

description: South Korea will raise the cap on meal expenses for public officials for the first time in eight years to better reflect the recent inflationary pressures, the anti-graft agency said Tuesday.
title: South Korea Revises Anti-Graft Law, Uplifts Meal Expense Limit

description: Donald Trump may already be influencing the economic agenda in China, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.
title: Goldman Sees China Saving Fiscal Firepower to Prepare for Trump

description: Opposition-controlled states in India slammed Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government after it allocated billions of dollars of funds to two of his allies in this year’s budget.
title: Modi Faces Backlash From States After Allies Get Budget Aid

description: The three Chinese automakers singled out by the European Union in its anti-subsidy probe have sought and received additional hearings with regulators from the bloc as Beijing and Brussels continue to negotiate ahead of a November deadline to finalize the tariffs.
title: Chinese Carmakers Push Back Against Tariffs in New EU Hearings

description: Hamzah Haz, the vice president of Indonesia from 2001 to 2004, has passed away. He died at the age of 84.
title: Former Indonesia Vice President Hamzah Haz Dies at 84

description: Poland has threatened to choke off a key Chinese rail export route to the European Union in a diplomatic gambit to slow escalating the migration crisis on its eastern border.
title: Poland Leverages China’s Rail Link in Europe to Rein In Belarus

description: A balloon sent from North Korea carrying trash landed on a government compound in Seoul housing the presidential office and an investigation showed the balloon contained no harmful materials, the presidential security service said.
title: North Korea Trash Balloon Lands in South Korea’s Presidential Compound

description: The Communist Party’s pledge to gradually increase the retirement age has renewed unease in China, where people’s livelihoods are already challenged by a sluggish job market, persistent hiring discrimination and evolving technologies.
title: China’s Proposal to Raise Retirement Age Sparks Worker Unease

description: Thailand’s Constitutional Court will rule on Aug. 14 if Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin should be removed from office for an alleged ethical violation, a case that could spur renewed political turmoil in Southeast Asia’s second-biggest economy.
title: Thai Court to Decide August on Plea That May See PM Ousted

description: Malaysia’s Trade Ministry is reviewing its anti-dumping legislation and plans to present it to parliament next year, joining Indonesia in heeding concerns about cheap Chinese products hurting local businesses.
title: Malaysia Reviews Dumping Laws as Cheap China Goods Spark Concern

description: The European Union must remain committed to its policy that any talks about ending the war in Ukraine should be led by the government in Kyiv, Portuguese Foreign Minister Paulo Rangel said.
title: Portugal Says Ukraine Alone Should Organize Any Peace Process

description: China relocated an official from Tibet to lead its crackdown on the financial sector, indicating no let-up in its unprecedented efforts to clean up the industry.
title: China Brings Official From Tibet to Lead Banker Crackdown

description: Elon Musk confirmed Tuesday that he was “making some donations” to a super political action committee supporting Donald Trump’s presidential campaign, though at a “much lower level” than has been reported.
title: Musk Confirms ‘Lower Level’ Donations to Pro-Trump Super PAC

description: Bangladesh relaxed a curfew imposed after mass protests last week, allowing garment factories and banks to reopen and restoring a semblance of normalcy following deadly clashes between students and the police.
title: Bangladesh Factories, Banks, Stock Market Reopen as Curfew Eased

description: Hundreds of police officers from New York City and other jurisdictions will help guard the US Capitol as large protests are expected when Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addresses a joint meeting of Congress on Wednesday.
title: New York Police Officers Reinforce US Capitol for Netanyahu Speech

description: North Korea’s state media rebuffed comments that former President Donald Trump made about good ties with leader Kim Jong Un, saying “we do not care” and warned its nuclear arsenal stands ready for any US leader.
title: North Korea Does ‘Not Care’ About Trump’s Words for Kim Jong Un

description: Indian Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman delivered her seventh budget speech on Tuesday, pledging to create more jobs, boost spending on infrastructure while still reining in the fiscal deficit.
title: India’s Budget in Five Key Charts: More Spending, Debt Control
